definition: martial arts chivalry (Chinese literary, theatrical and cinema genre)/knight-errant
surname Wu
martial/military
knight-errant/brave and chivalrous/hero/heroic
a martial arts (wuxia) novel

sentences.english: So this time, would you please say something about Wuxia novels?
sentences.chinese: 所以，这次想请您谈谈武侠小说。

sentences.english: Well, I think the world of Wuxia is more than a utopia. It is a cultural harbor where one can anchor.
sentences.chinese: “武侠”，不只是想象的世界，更是文化心灵的寄托。

sentences.english: The film is a parody of the novel The Legend of the Condor Heroes by Louis Cha.
sentences.chinese: 该片是金庸武侠小说《射雕英雄传》的恶搞版。

sentences.english: It is adopted from the first classic of Mr. Wan Ray-an, a master of new style of martial arts novels.
sentences.chinese: 改编自新派武侠小说名家温瑞安先生的首部经典大作。

sentences.english: That boy's heroic knight-errant, like exuberant charm.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩英勇的武侠，如旺盛的魅力。

sentences.english: The development of China's swordsmen film follows the law of periodic.
sentences.chinese: 武侠电影的历史，遵循着周期性发展的运行规律。

sentences.english: Chivalric novels are subject to the internal influence of traditional fictional paradigms.
sentences.chinese: 武侠小说受传统范式的影响有其特定的规定性。

sentences.english: The book I randomly picked up was a kung fu novel by Louis Cha, a famous Hong Kong writer.
sentences.chinese: 我随便捡了一本，是香港著名作家金庸写的武侠小说。

sentences.english: I although am the girl, but extremely likes reading the chivalric fiction novel.
sentences.chinese: 我虽然是女孩，不过非常喜欢看武侠小说。

sentences.english: But someone said that the swordsman was a dream of the modern people.
sentences.chinese: 但是有人说武侠只是现代人的梦。

sentences.english: I like Kungfu novels by Louis Cha.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢金庸的武侠小说。

sentences.english: Do you like martial arts novels?
It is named flowers because the host loves flowers, maybe also he loves Chivalric fiction novels.
sentences.chinese: 因主人爱花，也可能是喜欢武侠小说，因而为名。

sentences.english: He had to endure snide remarks by the Furious Five.
sentences.chinese: 他也必须容忍无畏武侠的论断。

sentences.english: Butthese of studying , neglect by a lot of people in past film .
sentences.chinese: 但这在以往的徐克武侠电影研究中，被很多人所忽略。

sentences.english: After the movie Ashes of Time, later such new-version knight-errant films gradually declined.
sentences.chinese: 《东邪西毒》之后，新武侠电影开始走下坡路。

definition: a martial arts (wuxia) novel
Jin Yong, pen name of Louis Cha (1924-2018), wuxia 武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2] novelist, author of the 1957-1961 Condor Trilogy
Tsui Hark (1951-), Chinese movie director and producer
Gu Long (1938-1985), Taiwanese wuxia novelist and screenwriter
acrobatic fighting in Chinese opera or dance
Legend of the Condor Heroes, wuxia (武侠, martial arts chivalry) novel by Jin Yong 金庸 and its screen adaptations
action movie/kungfu movie
action movie/CL:部[bu4]
Wong Fei Hung (1847-1924), famous martial artist and revolutionary
ancient Chinese divination tradition (still in use today)
Demigods and Semidevils, wuxia novel by Jin Yong 金庸[Jin1 Yong1] and its TV and screen adaptations
science fiction/abbr. for 科學幻想|科学幻想[ke1 xue2 huan4 xiang3]
fantasy (fiction)
suspense
